children.value: Status conditions are states that affect a character's behavior in various ways.
All statuses besides "Regular" can be categorized as positive or negative.
except for Super (and its boosts), Dueling, Dodger, Cautious, Reflective, and Zen.
For information about auras, check the
Negative statuses can be removed by items like
status will protect you from negative statuses)
You can check your current status from the menu. (Other → Current State)
Most status conditions wear off after a number of turns, or when you change floors.
status and corresponding bonuses will remain active)
Being revived by Revival Grass or Undo Grass will remove all status conditions
except for Dodger, Cautious, Reflective, and Zen.
Negative statuses can be removed by items like
status will protect the ally from negative statuses)
Negative statuses can be removed by a
status will protect the monster from negative statuses)
Nixer Scroll will have no effect if used on a monster that has a negative status.
※ Status names are a bit inconsistent within the game, so all alternate names are listed.

Status Target Effect Causes
Slow Shiren Perform 1 action every 2 turns. Slow Trap, Poison Grass,
Mutaikons, Mage Staff,
Slow Staff, Slow Talisman,
MC Sorceror
Ally
Monster The above, Water Pot
Swift,
Haste		 Shiren Perform 2 actions every turn. DJ Mage, Swift Grass,
Shrine Maid. Pot,
Swift Talisman
Ally
Monster The above, Swift Foe Scroll,
Gambler's Scroll
Confused Shiren Movement or attack goes in a random direction. (12 turns)
Projectiles, thrown items, and staves can be used normally.
If a direct attack turns to face an ally, it'll deal damage.		 Spin Trap, Dazikon,
MC Mage, Mage Staff,
MC Wizard, Foly,
Confusion Grass,
Conf. Talisman
Ally Moves randomly, and attacks if a creature is in the way.
Monster Moves randomly, and won't use special attacks. (20 turns)
Attacks if a creature is in the way, but the game performs
a second movement check if it's another monster, so it's
a bit rare for confused monsters to attack other monsters.		 The above,
Confusion Scroll
Asleep Shiren Unable to perform any actions for 6 turns. Sleep Trap, Mage Staff,
Sleepy Grass, Naptapirs,
Sleep Talisman, Dozikon
Ally
Monster
Sound Asleep,
Sound Sleep,
Slumbering		 Shiren Unable to perform any actions for 12 turns.
Action speed is increased by 1 stage afterward.		 Slumber Talisman
Ally
Monster The above,
Slumber Scroll
Blind Shiren Field of view reduced to zero for 10 turns, can't read scrolls.
Overwrites Farseeing status.
Check for walls using show tiles controls.
If you can detect enemies, they will be visible on the map.
(Example: having a Monster Detector equipped)
All other creatures will display as "Someone".		 Blind Trap, Kid Squids,
Drama Staff, MC Mage,
Blinding Grass
Ally Walks in a straight line until they hit something. (10 turns)
Changes directions if they hit a wall, and attacks if they
bump into Shiren, NPCs, or monsters. Monsters won't use
special attacks.
Monster The above, Darkroom
Paralyzed Shiren Unable to act until attacked or hit by an effect.
The paralysis wears off after 40 turns.		 MC Mage, MC Wizard,
Paralysis Staff,
Transient Staff,
Maneaters
Ally Unable to act until attacked or hit by an effect.
Monster The above, Fixer Scroll
S-Paralyzed,
Super Paralyzed		 Shiren Unable to act until attacked or hit by an effect 2 times.
The paralysis wears off after 40 turns.		 Paralysis Staff (blessed),
Transient Staff (blessed)
Ally Unable to act until attacked or hit by an effect 2 times.
(Changes to Paralyzed after being hit 1 time)
Monster
Empathetic Shiren When the target who inflicted this status takes damage,
Shiren or the ally receives the same amount of damage.
You won't receive damage if you defeat the target in 1 hit.
Lasts until target is gone from floor, or you change floors.		 MC Sorceror,
Sharing Staff,
Empathy Staff
Ally
Monster Target takes the same amount of damage when you're hit.
S-Empathetic,
Super Empathetic		 Shiren When the target who inflicted this status takes damage,
Shiren or the ally will receive double the amount of damage.
You won't receive damage if you defeat the target in 1 hit.
Lasts until target is gone from floor, or you change floors.		 Empathy Staff (blessed),
Sharing Staff (blessed)
Ally
Monster Target takes double the amount of damage when you're hit.
Hiding Shiren Unable to act for 20 turns. Won't be detected by monsters.
Collapse if you hide while on an air or water tile.		 Hide Pot
Ally Unable to act. Won't be detected by monsters.
Break free by talking or being hit by an attack or effect.
Collapse if they hide while on an air or water tile.
Monster Unable to act, but won't be detected by other monsters.
Can't break free until they get hit by an attack or effect.
Collapse if they hide while on an air or water tile.
Cloned,
Substitution		 Shiren Same as Confused status. Clone Staff,
MC Wizard
Ally Transforms into Fake Shiren for 30 turns.
Monsters will aim for the fake, but allies won't attack it.
Trying to talk to the fake will result in attacking it.
Only 1 fake can be present, so the first character returns
to normal and is left Confused if a 2nd fake is made.
Monster Transforms into Fake Shiren for 30 turns.
Monsters will prioritize it over Shiren and his allies.
The fake won't use special attacks, and is treated as a
character on land, even if it's a Floating or Aquatic type.
Some monsters won't use special attacks if a fake is visible.
Only one fake can be present at a time, so the first monster will
return to normal and be left Confused if a second fake is made.
Enduring Shiren Lets you survive what would've been a fatal blow with 1 HP.
Wears off after activating, or if you advance 2 floors.		 Juicy Peach
Ally
Monster
Apathetic Monster Unable to perform any actions for 6 turns. Amnesia Grass,
Gauge Blind. Trap
Berserk Shiren Player loses control of Shiren for 30 turns.
During that time, Shiren will search out and attack the nearest creature.
He won't charge into walls if you have a Wall Clip Bracelet equipped.		 Rage Grass,
Mesmerikon,
MC Wizard, Foly,
Berserker Tal.
Ally Can't use special attacks, and attacks the nearest creature for 30 turns.
Monster Can't use special attacks, and attacks the nearest creature for 30 turns.
Night monsters are immune to this status.
Shadow Bound Shiren Prevents you from moving for 3 turns.
You can still attack and change directions.		 Shadow Bind Tal.,
Shadow Bind Trap,
Foly
Ally Prevents movement, but can still attack and change directions.
Monster Prevents movement for 10 turns, but can still attack and change directions.
Afraid Shiren Reverses the direction of your attacks and thrown items for 15 turns.
Movement is not affected.		 Fear Talisman
Ally Can't use special attacks, and attack direction is reversed for 15 turns.
Monster The above, Fear Scroll,
Dicey Distractor
Sealed Shiren Same as Muzzled status, but also can't use staves. (20 turns)
However, you can still eat peaches.		 Seal Staff, MC Wizard,
Seal Talisman
Ally Can't use special attacks, and can't talk to Shiren. The above, Imabikiso
Monster Can't use special attacks or abilities, but action speed is unchanged. The above, Water Pot,
Room Sealant
Inaccurate Shiren Direct attacks will always miss for 10 turns.
However, if the target is Asleep or Paralyzed, the attack will still connect.		 Inacc. Talisman, Foly
Ally Direct attacks will always miss for 10 turns.
Monster
Onigiri Shiren Transforms into an onigiri for 10 turns.
Attack and defense get set to 0, and equipment effects are nullified.
You can't use items or abilities, and you can't ascend or descend stairs.
You'll immediately collapse if you get hit by fire or explosion damage,
or if you step on a Decay Trap or land on a water tile.		 Onigiri Trap, Nigiri Boss,
MC Sorceror, Nigiri King
Ally
Monster Transforms into an onigiri for 10 turns.
Attack and defense get set to 0, and can't use special attacks or abilities.
Turns into a Grilled Onigiri if hit by fire or explosion damage.
Turns into a Rotten Onigiri if it steps on a Decay Trap, gets splashed
by water from a Water Pot, or lands on a water tile.
Nigiri Baby monsters are immune to this status, and will be Buffed instead.		 The above,
Onigiri Bonanza
Tottering Monster Unable to perform any actions for 6 turns, and receives double damage.
If the target was a Mixer, it will drop swallowed items on the ground.		 Oil Scroll
Enraged,
Rage		 Shiren Doubles attack power for 15 turns. Enraged Talisman
Ally
Monster Doubles attack power for 50 turns. The above, Rage Trap
Furious,
Super Enraged		 Shiren Doubles attack power and grants Swift status for 15 turns. Furious Talisman
Ally
Monster Doubles attack power and grants Swift status for 15 turns.
(Can attack 2 times per turn)
Plated,
Plating		 Shiren Makes the character immune to most attacks and traps.
The plating has a chance to wear off when hit by attacks or trap effects.		 Mekky (NPC)
Ally
Farseeing Shiren Reveals hidden traps, and lets you read scrolls without light at night.
Overwrites Blind status.
Wears off if you're inflicted with Blind status, or if you change floors.		 Perception Grass
Ally Overwrites Blind status.
Monster
Gauge Blind,
Gauge Vanish		 Shiren HP and fullness bars are hidden for 100 turns.
Other stats show as ????, stopping you from checking your current status.		 Gauge Blind. Trap
Muzzled Shiren Unable to eat, read, use abilities, or talk to allies or Shopkeepers
Wears off when you change floors.		 Muzzled Scroll
Grounded Shiren Unable to pick up items, but can still use items that are on the ground.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Grounded Scroll, Foly
Hypnotized Shiren Face a random direction and attack, use an item, or throw an item. (1 turn) Gazers
Ally Same as Confused status.
Monster
Grassnesia Shiren Unable to use or throw grass items for 100 turns. Myriman
Scrollnesia Shiren Unable to use or throw scrolls for 100 turns. Billman
Staffnesia Shiren Unable to use or throw staves for 100 turns. Trillman
Potnesia Shiren Unable to use or throw pots for 100 turns. Googoman
Laughing Shiren Unable to perform any actions for 6 turns. Hilarious Pot
Ally
Monster Unable to perform any actions for 6 turns.
The laughter spreads to adjacent enemies and other enemies in the room.
All enemies stop laughing when one enemy recovers.
Napping Monster The monster is sleeping and won't wake up on its own.
May wake up when you move next to it, or when you enter or exit the room.
Floaty, Karakuroid, and Zalokleft monsters are always generated napping,
along with monsters inside regular Monster Houses.		 -
Invincible Shiren Nullifies all damage received for 20 turns.
However, this status doesn't protect against effects unrelated to damage.		 Invincible Grass,
Shrine Maid. Pot
Ally
Monster
Potted Shiren Your hand is stuck in a pot, and your weapon is unequipped.
Unable to pick up or use items, and can't use abilities.
Wears off when you change floors, or step on a Strip Trap.
Chance for the pot to shatter when you attack or get hit by enemies.		 Sticky Pot
Tinkerer,
Reinforcer		 Shiren Gain x4.0 equipment skill points when you defeat enemies for 100 turns.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Upgrade Seed
Cannon Arm Shiren Thrown items and projectiles fly forever, going through walls and creatures.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Dracon Grass
Immune Shiren Makes the character immune to negative status conditions.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Immunity Scroll,
Peach (blessed)
Ally
Monster Makes the monster immune to negative status conditions. Peach (blessed)
Klein Shiren Attack power and defense are switched for 20 turns.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Klein Pot
Ally Attack power and defense are switched for 20 turns.
Monster
Fast Regen Shiren Increases natural HP regeneration per turn by 1 HP.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Self-Help
Night Vision Shiren Lets you read scrolls without light at night.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Beacon of Light
Zen,
Reflector		 Shiren Makes characters immune to fire and explosion damage.
Includes Dragon, Firepuff, Pop Tank, Explochin special attacks or abilities,
Explosion / Big Explosion traps, Explosion Bracelet, 4-2-8 and Fever pots.
Onigiri can still be grilled, but you won't collapse if you have Onigiri status.
Wears off when you change floors. (Shiren reviving doesn't remove it)		 Zen Pot
Ally
Monster
Dodger Shiren Projectiles and thrown items always miss.
Includes Bored Kappa, Field Knave, Porky, Scoopie, Mutaikon, Bow Boy,
and Grass Boy special attacks.
Wears off when you change floors. (Shiren reviving doesn't remove it)		 Dodger Pot
Ally
Monster
Reflective,
Cautious		 Shiren Reflects all magic.
Includes DJ Mage, Gazer, and Polygon Spinna special attacks.
Gazer's hypnosis is reflected as confusion, and Polygon Spinna's special
attack is reflected as damage.
Wears off when you change floors. (Shiren reviving doesn't remove it)		 Reflection Pot
Ally
Monster
Cautious,
Watcher		 Shiren You won't drop items, and others can't steal items from you.
Includes Zalokleft, Froggo, Gyadon, Swordsman, higher level
Field Knave special attacks, and Trip Traps.
Wears off when you change floors. (Shiren reviving doesn't remove it)		 Perceptive Pot
Ally
Monster
Ninja,
Tiptoe		 Shiren Napping monsters won't wake up when you move next to them
or when you enter or exit the room.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Special Onigiri
Knowledgeable,
Mass Identifier		 Shiren Items are automatically identified when picked up or inserted into pots.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Special Onigiri
Satiated Shiren Stops natural fullness depletion.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Special Onigiri
Insomnia Shiren You won't fall asleep.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Special Onigiri
Unwavering,
Power Save		 Shiren Your strength can't be decreased.
Wears off when you change floors.		 Special Onigiri
Starving,
Hunger		 Shiren Natural HP regeneration stops, and you lose 1 HP every turn.
Canceled when your fullness increases is above 0.		 Fullness reaches 0
Danger,
Pinch		 Shiren Shiren's current HP is less than 30% of his max HP. (HP bar turns red)
Wears off when Shiren's HP increases above 30% of his max HP.		 HP < 30% of max HP
Buffed,
Empowered		 Shiren Boosts damage dealt by 50% per stage. (8 stages max)
Damage dealt = 150%, 200%, 250%, 300%, 350%, 400%, 450%, 500%.		 Power Up Grass
Ally Power Up Grass,
Strength Grass
Monster
Weakened Shiren Decreases damage dealt by about 50%. (8 stages max)
Damage reduction = 50%, 60%, 70%, 80%, 90%, 95%, 97%, 99%		 Rotten Peach
Ally Rotten Peach, Strip Trap,
Poison Grass, Water Pot,
Poison Arrow, Hunger Trap
Monster
Bolstered,
Fortified		 Shiren Decreases damage received by about 50%. (8 stages max)
Damage reduction = 50%, 60%, 70%, 80%, 90%, 95%, 97%, 99%		 Hard Peach
Ally
Monster
Wizened Shiren Increases damage received by 50% per stage. (8 stages max)
Damage taken = 150%, 200%, 250%, 300%, 350%, 400%, 450%, 500%.		 Rotten Peach
Ally Rotten Peach, Strip Trap,
Rust Trap
Monster
Dueling Monster The monster might drop a license when defeated by Shiren. (20 turns) Duelist Trap
Awakened-ish,
Nearly Awakened		 Shiren Chance to occur when you defeat enemies.
Chance to wear off when a hunger message is displayed, turns elapse
while you're Starving or in Danger, you step on a trap, or are inflicted
with a negative status condition.		 Chance to occur when
you defeat enemies
during an adventure
Super Shiren Chance to occur when you defeat enemies while Awakened-ish.
Gain one of the following bonuses every 10 enemies you defeat:
Overwhelming, Indomitable, Modder, Super Swift, Fast Striking, Precise.
Your direct attacks have a chance to inflict Confused, Blind, Berserk,
Asleep, Paralyzed, Sealed, or Shadow Bound status.
Chance to wear off when a hunger message is displayed, turns elapse
while you're Starving or in Danger, you step on a trap, or are inflicted
with a negative status condition. (Lose all bonuses when it wears off)		 Chance to occur when
you defeat enemies
while Awakened-ish
Overwhelming Shiren Same as Buffed status, but lasts 3 floors. Super status
Indomitable Shiren Same as Bolstered status, but lasts 3 floors. Super status
Super Swift Shiren Same as Swift status, but lasts 50 turns.
(100 turns from Shiren's perspective)		 Super status
Modder Shiren Same as Tinkerer status, but lasts 2 floors. Super status
Fast Striking,
Swift Striking		 Shiren Perform 2 direct attacks per turn for 50 turns. Super status
Precise,
Deadly Accurate		 Shiren Direct attacks always deal a critical hit for 50 turns. Super status
Doub-ility ??? Status condition in the game files.
No description.		 Water Pot effect that
makes monsters use
special attacks often?
Tame ??? Status condition in the game files.
No description.		 Tamed monsters?
(Monster Licenses)
Wait ??? Status condition in the game files.
No description.		 ???
ChestnutCount ??? Status condition in the game files.
"While in this state you'll earn extra
experience points for defeating enemies."		 Sweet Nuts eating items?

export const _frontmatter = {"title":"Status Conditions","metaTitle":"Status Conditions - Shiren the Wanderer: Tower of Fortune Wiki","metaDescription":"List of status conditions for Shiren the Wanderer: The Tower of Fortune and the Dice of Fate."}

val.rawMDXOutput:
/* @jsx mdx */ import { mdx } from '@mdx-js/react'; /* @jsxRuntime classic */ /* @jsx mdx */ export const _frontmatter = { "title": "Status Conditions", "metaTitle": "Status Conditions - Shiren the Wanderer: Tower of Fortune Wiki", "metaDescription": "List of status conditions for Shiren the Wanderer: The Tower of Fortune and the Dice of Fate." }; const layoutProps = { _frontmatter }; const MDXLayout = "wrapper" export default function MDXContent({ components, ...props }) { return

{`Overview`}

{`Status conditions are states that affect a character's behavior in various ways.`}
{` All statuses besides "Regular" can be categorized as positive or negative.`}

{`Absorbiphant`}{` monsters and the Sparrow `}{`NPC`}{` can remove all status conditions`}
{` except for Super (and its boosts), Dueling, Dodger, Cautious, Reflective, and Zen.`}

{`For information about auras, check the `}{`Gameplay Basics`}{` page.`}

{`Shiren`}

  • {`Negative statuses can be removed by items like `}{`Peach`}{`, `}{`Fixer Scroll`}{`, or `}{`Immunity Scroll`}{`.`}
    {`(`}{`Immune`}{` status will protect you from negative statuses)`}
  • {`You can check your current status from the menu. (Other → Current State)`}
  • {`Most status conditions wear off after a number of turns, or when you change floors.`}
  • {`(However, `}{`Super`}{` status and corresponding bonuses will remain active)`}
  • {`Being revived by Revival Grass or Undo Grass will remove all status conditions`}
    {`except for Dodger, Cautious, Reflective, and Zen.`}

{`Allies`}

  • {`Negative statuses can be removed by items like `}{`Peach`}{` or `}{`Immunity Scroll`}{`.`}
    {`(`}{`Immune`}{` status will protect the ally from negative statuses)`}

{`Monsters`}

  • {`Negative statuses can be removed by a `}{`Peach`}{` or `}{`Cure Monster Trap`}{`.`}
    {`(`}{`Immune`}{` status will protect the monster from negative statuses)`}
  • {`Nixer Scroll will have no effect if used on a monster that has a negative status.`}

{`Status List`}

{`Key: `}{`Positive`}{`, `}{`Negative`}{`, `}{`Special`}
{` ※ Status names are a bit inconsistent within the game, so all alternate names are listed.`}

Status Target Effect Causes

Floaty, Karakuroid, and Zalokleft monsters are always generated napping,
along with monsters inside regular Monster Houses.		 -
